title: Sandusky man pleads guilty to shooting nephew
content:
A Sandusky man has pleaded guilty to endangering children after accidentally shooting his 7-year-old nephew in his face.
Ervin Clinton Jr., 36, is set to be sentenced at 10:30 a.m. Nov. 10 in Erie County Common Pleas Court.
Clinton was arrested at a trailer park in the early morning hours of June 1.
Sandusky police Detective Ken Nixon previously reported that the shooting involved Clinton’s nephew, whom he was watching with another person on May 29 at his home.

Clinton had his gun out when it accidentally went off and struck his nephew in his face on the left side of his nose. Nixon said it went in a downward angle and came out on the right side of the boy’s neck right below his ear. He added no vital organs, veins or arteries were hit.
The detective said Clinton visited his nephew May 31 at Rainbow Babies & Children’s Hospital and described him as alert and was able to remember what happened.
The detective said as soon as the boy was able to speak, he said, “My uncle shot me.” The boy said it was an accident.
Nixon said it’s likely Clinton fled because he is a convicted felon who shouldn’t have a firearm.
It was determined that the gun involved in the incident wasn’t reported stolen, but Nixon said that doesn’t necessarily mean it wasn’t.
